text: 76 years ago, Allied Forces took incredible risks on beaches of Normandy to liberate an entire continent and secure our most sacred freedoms. Good advice beyond context of this tweet

On one side it’s not enough to just hear from others,you have to LISTEN

On the other,my conversations this week confirmed what I believed

For many it isn’t that they just DON’T CARE

It’s that they can’t care about what they DON’T KNOW https://twitter.com/realrclark25/status/1269256211045761024 QT @Realrclark25 You can’t ask people for change & then refuse to allow people the opportunity to do so. If they’re listening, let them listen. If they make the effort, work with them. The pain of the past can’t be erased, but the future can look much different when right is the only way!

Why is it so hard to just report what is obvious to everyone

We have two groups here

A. Real protestors who don’t attack anyone & generally comply with curfews.They are NOT the the problem.

B. Violent extremists fomenting anarchy once the sun goes down. They are the problem. https://twitter.com/multcoso/status/1269168037980061697 QT @MultCoSO It’s not just water bottles. These are the items that are being launched at officers. Bricks, glass bottles, blades, ball bearings, mortars and batteries. At high speeds, these items can be deadly. Barr needs to explain under oath whether he ordered peaceful protesters to be forcibly cleared out near the White House this week.
